meanings.definition: An early or primitive form of human beings.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study the fossils of protohumans to learn about our ancestors.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a skeleton of a protohuman for visitors to see.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled at the idea of protohumans wearing funny hats.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the protagonist felt a connection to protohumans, imagining their struggles.
meanings.sent5: The documentary vividly portrayed the daily life of protohumans in ancient times.

meanings.definition: Belonging to or characteristic of protohumans.
meanings.sent1: The researcher discovered tools that were used by protohumans long ago.
meanings.sent2: The cave paintings showed scenes of protohuman life in prehistoric times.
meanings.sent3: The old book described a world where buildings were made by protohumans.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled with curiosity as she examined the artifacts of protohuman culture.
meanings.sent5: The ancient relic had intricate carvings that reflected the artistry of protohumans.

meanings.definition: Study of the evolution of protohumans.
meanings.sent1: Anthropologists dedicate their careers to researching the evolution of protohumans.
meanings.sent2: The university offers a course on the history and development of protohumans.
meanings.sent3: During the lecture, the professor shared fascinating discoveries about protohumans.
meanings.sent4: The documentary highlighted the advancements in technology used to study protohumans.
meanings.sent5: The museum exhibit showcased the latest findings in the field of protohuman evolution.
